page.title: 06CHURCHES IN BURY & HOUGHTON
page.content: There are 3 churches, two of Church of England denomination, whilst the other is Roman Catholic. The first two churches are very old being started in the late 12th century, whilst the R.C. church in Houghton is a modern building. As is usual in these days, the sizes of the congregations are relatively small in the old churches of the united parish of Bury with Houghton; but the R.C. Church has a larger congregation due, inter alia, to serving a much wider area. The older churches have many Norman features and in the Bury church a door outline which gave easy access from Bury Manor can be seen in the north wall. Dorset House schoolboys attend services there every other Saturday morning during term time; the choir consists of some of those boys with the school music master as organist.
